page.title: 16NEWBURY FARM RODMERSHAM
page.content: Newbury's 370 acres are mainly wheat, oats, barley, potatoes, fruit & oilseed rape. Years ago no rape was grown but more fruit, as well as worzel & kale. Wheat now covers most land but the Bramley cooking apples bring in most money. Dessert & cooking apples are grown as well as cherries, pears & plums. These fruits are sent to London, Glasgow, Liverpool, & sometimes Nottingham. The fruit is picked by casual pickers who might live in caravans on the farm. The oil seed rape is grown under contract. This year there are 940 sheep _ 430 ewes, 500 lambs & 10 rams. The recently covered large yard houses 200 bullocks of various ages in the winter. There were once more buildings than now. An oasthouse, stables, piggeries & an old barn have been replaced by modern buildings.
